info.title: ORY Keto
info.description: Ory Keto is a cloud native access control server providing best-practice patterns (RBAC, ABAC, ACL, AWS IAM Policies, Kubernetes Roles, ...) via REST APIs.

delete.summary: Deletes relationships based on relation query

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace this relation tuple lives in.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description:
The object related by this tuple.
It is an object in the namespace of the tuple.

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description: The relation between an Object and a Subject.

parameters.name: subject_id
parameters.description: A concrete id of the subject.

parameters.name: subject_set.namespace
parameters.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

parameters.name: subject_set.object
parameters.description: The object related by this subject set.

parameters.name: subject_set.relation
parameters.description: The relation between the object and the subjects.

parameters.name: relationTuple
parameters.description: The relationship to create.

patch.summary: Writes one or more relationships in a single transaction.

parameters.name: relationTupleDeltas
parameters.description:
The write delta for the relationships operated in one single transaction.
Either all actions succeed or no change takes effect on error.

200.description: The result of the syntax checker

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Optional. The maximum number of
RelationTuples to return in the response.

Default: 100

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Optional. An opaque pagination token returned from
a previous call to `ListRelationTuples` that
indicates where the page should start at.

An empty token denotes the first page. All successive
pages require the token from the previous page.

post.summary: Performs an authorization check for a batch of tuples.
post.description: To learn how relationship tuples and the check works, head over to [the documentation](https://www.ory.sh/docs/keto/concepts/api-overview).

200.description: The response of the permission check, in case it is allowed. For the `/openapi` endpoints, the status code is always 200.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Batch Check Permission Body.

parameters.name: max-depth
parameters.description:
The maximum depth to search for a relation.

If the value is less than 1 or greater than the global
max-depth then the global max-depth will be used instead.

200.description: The response of the permission check, in case it is allowed. For the `/openapi` endpoints, the status code is always 200.

403.description: The response of the permission check, in case it is not allowed. For the `/openapi` endpoints, the status code is always 200.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
The namespace to evaluate the check.

Note: If you use the expand-API and the check
evaluates a RelationTuple specifying a SubjectSet as
subject or due to a rewrite rule in a namespace config
this check request may involve other namespaces automatically.

parameters.description: The related object in this check.

referenced in this subject set.

If the value is less than 1 or greater than the global
max-depth then the global max-depth will be used instead.

403.description: The response of the permission check, in case it is not allowed. For the `/openapi` endpoints, the status code is always 200.

get.summary: Expands the subject set into a tree of subjects.

200.description: The response of the permission check, in case it is allowed. For the `/openapi` endpoints, the status code is always 200.

parameters.name: max-depth
parameters.description:
The maximum depth of tree to build.

If the value is less than 1 or greater than the global
max-depth then the global max-depth will be used instead.

It is important to set this parameter to a meaningful
value. Ponder how deep you really want to display this.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object related by this subject set.

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description: The relation between the object and the subjects.

get.summary: Returns the version of the Ory Keto instance.
get.description:
This endpoint returns the service version typically notated using semantic versioning.

If the service supports TLS Edge Termination, this endpoint does not require the
X-Forwarded-Proto header to be set.

results.description:
The results of the batch check. The order of these
results will match the order of the input.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.BatchC.description: The response for a CheckService.BatchCheck rpc.

namespace.description:
The namespace to evaluate the check.

Note: If you use the expand-API and the check
evaluates a RelationTuple specifying a SubjectSet as
subject or due to a rewrite rule in a namespace config
this check request may involve other namespaces automatically.

object.description: The related object in this check.

relation.description: The relation between the Object and the Subject.

subject_id.description: A concrete id of the subject.

subject_set.description:
A subject set that expands to more Subjects.
More information are available under [concepts](../concepts/subjects.mdx).

max-depth.description:
The maximum depth to search for a relation.

If the value is less than 1 or greater than the global
max-depth then the global max-depth will be used instead.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.CheckR.description:
The request for a CheckService.Check RPC.
Checks whether a specific subject is related to an object.

allowed.description:
Whether the specified subject (id)
is related to the requested object.

It is false by default if no ACL matches.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.CheckR.description: The response for a permission check.

allowed.description:
Whether the specified subject (id)
is related to the requested object.

It is false by default if no ACL matches.

error.description:
If there was an error checking the tuple,
this will contain the error message.

If the check was performed successfully, this will be empty.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.CheckR.description: The response for an individual check in the CheckService.BatchCheck rpc.

namespace.description: The namespace this relation tuple lives in.

object.description:
The object related by this tuple.
It is an object in the namespace of the tuple.

relation.description: The relation between an Object and a Subject.

subject_id.description: A concrete id of the subject.

subject_set.description:
A subject set that expands to more Subjects.
More information are available under [concepts](../concepts/subjects.mdx).

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Create.description: The response from creating a new relationship.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.ErrorR.description: The standard Ory JSON API error format.
ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.ErrorR.title: JSON API Error Response

debug.description: Debug information is often not exposed to protect against leaking sensitive information.
debug.title: Debug information

id.description: The error ID is useful when trying to identify various errors in application logic.
id.title: The error ID

message.example: The requested resource could not be found.
message.title: The error message

reason.description: Reason holds a human-readable reason for the error.
reason.title: The error reason

request.description:
The request ID is often exposed internally in order to trace
errors across service architectures. This is often a UUID.
request.title: The request ID

status.description: Status holds the human-readable HTTP status code.
status.title: The status description

tree.description:
The tree the requested subject set expands to.
The requested subject set is the subject of the root.

This field can be nil in some circumstances.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Expand.description: The response for a ExpandService.Expand RPC.

version.description: The version string of the Ory Keto instance.

relation_tuples.description: The relationships matching the list request.

next_page_token.description:
The token required to get the next page.
If this is the last page, the token will be the empty string.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.ListRe.description: The response of a ReadService.ListRelationTuples RPC.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.NodeTy.description:
- union: This node expands to a union of all children.
 - exclusion: Not implemented yet.
 - intersection: Not implemented yet.
 - leaf: This node is a leaf and contains no children.
Its subject is a `SubjectID` unless `max_depth` was reached.
 - tuple_to_subject_set: This node is a leaf and contains no children.
Its subject is a `SubjectID` unless `max_depth` was reached.
 - computed_subject_set: This node is a leaf and contains no children.
Its subject is a `SubjectID` unless `max_depth` was reached.
 - not: This node is a leaf and contains no children.
Its subject is a `SubjectID` unless `max_depth` was reached.

namespace.description: The namespace this relation tuple lives in.

object.description:
The object related by this tuple.
It is an object in the namespace of the tuple.

relation.description: The relation between an Object and a Subject.

subject_id.description: A concrete id of the subject.

subject_set.description:
A subject set that expands to more Subjects.
More information are available under [concepts](../concepts/subjects.mdx).

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Relati.description: RelationTuple defines a relation between an Object and a Subject.

action.description: The action to do on the RelationTuple.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Relati.description:
- ACTION_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified.
The `TransactRelationTuples` RPC ignores this
RelationTupleDelta if an action was unspecified.
 - insert: Insertion of a new RelationTuple.
It is ignored if already existing.
 - delete: Deletion of the RelationTuple.
It is ignored if it does not exist.

id.description: A concrete id of the subject.

set.description:
A subject set that expands to more Subjects.
More information are available under [concepts](../concepts/15_subjects.mdx).

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Subjec.description:
Subject is either a concrete subject id or
a `SubjectSet` expanding to more Subjects.

namespace.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

object.description: The object related by this subject set.

relation.description: The relation between the object and the subjects.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Subjec.description:
SubjectSet refers to all subjects who have
the same `relation` on an `object`.

namespace.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

object.description: The object related by this subject set.

relation.description: The relation between the object and the subjects.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Subjec.description:
SubjectSetQuery refers to all subjects who have
the same `relation` on an `object`.

subject.description:
The subject this node represents.
Deprecated: More information is now available in the tuple field.

tuple.description: The relation tuple this node represents.

children.description:
The children of this node.

This is never set if `node_type` == `NODE_TYPE_LEAF`.

ory.keto.relation_tuples.v1alpha2.Transa.description: The response of a WriteService.TransactRelationTuples rpc.
